properties.description: The designing of the ball and the concept of the ball was done in the Adidas Headquarters in Herzogenaurach, Germany
properties.title: Adidas Headquarters

properties.description: NASA scientists concluded that the Jabulani, with its relatively smoother surface, the ball started to travel at a higher speed of 45–50 mph (72–80 km/h).
properties.title: Adidas Official Laboratory

properties.description:
used as the inner carcass of the ball. The inner carcass provides structure, shape and protection for the inner layers of the ball. 
manufactured in China
properties.title: Cotton Fabric

properties.description:
Fortunately Adidas released videos on various online video sites such as youtube, showing the process of making the ball in factories in China.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=zbLjk4OTRdI
properties.title: Manufacture Factory

properties.description:
Used as the inner carcass of the ball. The inner carcass provides structure, shape and protection for the inner layers of the ball. 
manufactured in China
properties.title: Isotropic polyester

properties.description:
The Jabulani ball has three dimensional panels. These then are spherically molded from Ethylene vinyl acetate. Ethylene vinyl acetate are Flexible, similar to rubber except it is translucent. It is known for its strength and resistance to tearing. 
Manufactured in China
properties.title: Ethylene vinyl acetate
Ink
properties.description:
Eleven different colors are used in the ball, and these eleven colors represent the eleven players in every team. The Ink is used for all of the colors of the ball and so, a large amount of Ink must be used. 
The Ink is manufactured in China.

properties.title: Glue
properties.description:
In order to attach the 3D tripod panel with the inner carcass (polyester and cotton fabric) the factories use glue by hand instead of mechanical solutions.
Glueing the panels together is cheaper than stitching. Manufactured in Japan

properties.title: Butyl
properties.description:
Used for the bladder of the ball. The first layer of the ball that maintains the air pressure for proper inflation. Butyl bladders retain air for longer periods of time compared to latex.
Manufactured in India

properties.title: Thermoplastic Polyurethane Elastomer
properties.description:
Used for the Windings of the ball. They add structural integrity and durability to the construction of the ball.
Manufactured in Taiwan

properties.title: Shanghai Giti Ball Factory
properties.description: Established in 2003, Giti Ball Factory specializes in the production and distribution of all kinds of promotional items and toys.

properties.title: Manufacture Factory
properties.description: One of the factories where the FIFA 2010 world cup ball s were manufactured. The materials for the Jabulani are transported to this factory, and then the ball is created by both machines and hand (humans).

properties.title: Designing and Creating Assistant
properties.description: Loughborough University helped Adidas within the creation and the designing of the ball, as they were research partners.

properties.title: Markets
properties.description: After the manufacturing of the balls are complete, they are shipped to markets all over the world, as the ball is sold in many different destinations for $149.99 (may vary depending on country)

properties.title: Thermoplastic Polyurethane Elastomer to Manufacture Factory

Jabulani
properties.description: This annotated map shows where the materials of the 2010 FIFA World Cup ball "Jabulani", come from as well as the process of the creation of the ball such as designing, manufacturing, etcetera.
